page.title: 17LOCAL POLITICS
page.content: The area, basically, tends to support {Labour.}We did a survey in May 1985, which showed 38% supported{Labour,}15% supported the{Conservatives,}17% were for the{SDP/Liberal Alliance,}6% were for the{SNP}and 24% were for other parties, or would not say. We have a Labour MP, 2 Labour and 1 Conservative Regional Councillors, and 3 Labour and 2 Conservative District Councillors. The vast majority of people (74%) saw {unemployment}as the most serious problem in our society today. In general we came to the conclusion that local people know very little about politics and the people who represent them. Less than 2/3 knew that{Dr. Gavin Strang}was their MP or what his party was; less than half knew who their Regional Councillor was; and less than 1 in 6 knew who their District Councillor was!
